para.text: DTOB - Drain Return Observation Package

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:2px; cell-spacing:2px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:1px; border-spacing:2px; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:raised-color; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: DTOB
Purpose
The Drain Return Observation input file allows observation of flows in the
package.
Documentation

li.link: Banta, E.R., 2000, MODFLOW-2000, the U.S. Geological Survey Modular Ground-Water Model - Documentation of Packages for Simulating Evapotranspiration with a Segmented Function (ETS1) and Drains with Return Flow (DRT1): U.S. Geological Survey Open-File Report 00-466, 127 p.

para.text: Related Packages
Supported in
MODFLOW-2000
Other Notes
The
package must be used in models in which the Drain Return Observation input file is used.
Input Instructions
Input for the file used to specify flow observations using the DRT1 Package is read from a file that is specified with “DTOB” as the file type listed in the name file.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:2px; cell-spacing:2px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:1px; border-spacing:2px; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:raised-color; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Data Set 0
[#Text]
Item 0 is optional and can include as many lines as desired. Each line needs to begin with the “#” character in the first column.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Text—is a character variable (79 characters) that starts in column 2. Any characters can be included in Text. The “#” character must be in column 1. Lines beginning with “#” are restricted to these first lines of the input file. Text is written to the LIST output file when the input file is read and provides an opportunity for the user to include information about the model both in the input file and the associated output file.
Data Set 1
NQDT NQCDT NQTDT (free format)

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NQDT—is the number of cell groups for which drain-return flow observations are listed. A group consists of the drain-return cells needed to represent one flow measurement. Recipient cells are not included in NQDT.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NQCDT—is greater than or equal to the total number of drain-return cells in all cell groups. NQCDT must be greater than or equal to the sum of all |
|. Recipient cells are not included in NQCDT.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NQTDT—is the total number of drain-return observations for all cell groups. NQTDT must equal the sum of all
, which are specified in repetitions of item 3 in the DTOB input file.
Data Set 2
TOMULTDT EVFDT IOWTQDT (free format)

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: TOMULTDT—is the time-offset multiplier for drain-return observations [-- or T/T]. The product of TOMULTDT and
must produce a time value in units consistent with other model input. TOMULTDT can be dimensionless or can be used to convert the units of
to the time unit used in the simulation.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: EVFDT—is the error variance multiplier for observations represented by the DRT1 Package, and is used to calculate the weights as described below in the explanation of
. EVFDT makes it easy to change the weights uniformly for all flow observations represented using the DRT1 Package.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: IOWTQDT—is a flag that indicates that the variance-covariance matrix on drain-return flow observations is to be read into array
of item 7. If IOWTQDT equals zero, weights are calculated using
of item 4; if it is greater than zero, items 6 and 7 are read and used to calculate the weights.
Read items 3, 4, and 5 for each of
groups of cells for which flow observations are to be specified for features simulated with the DRT1 Package.
Data Set 3
NQOBDT NQCLDT (free format)

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NQOBDT—is the number of times at which flows are observed for the group of cells.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NQCLDT—is a flag, and the absolute value of NQCLDT is the number of drain-return cells in the group. If NQCLDT is less than zero, FACTOR = 1.0 for all cells in the group. Recipient cells are not included in NQCLDT.
Data Set 4
OBSNAM IREFSP TOFFSET HOBS STATISTIC STAT-FLAG PLOT-SYMBOL (free format)
Read item 4 for each of
observation times for this group of cells. STATISTIC and STAT-FLAG are ignored if

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: OBSNAM—is a string of 1 to 12 non-blank characters used to identify the observation.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: IREFSP—is the reference stress period to which observation times are referenced. The reference point is the beginning of the stress period.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: TOFFSET—is the time offset of the observation from the beginning of stress period IREFSP [T]. TOFFSET must be in units such that the product of
and TOFFSET is in time units consistent with other model input. TOFFSET and
from the DTOB file and values of
, and

from the DIS file (Harbaugh and others, 2000) are used to determine the stress period, time step, and time during the time step for the observation. To specify that an observation is for a steady-state model solution, specify IREFSP as the stress-period number of the steady-state stress period, and specify TOFFSET such that
*TOFFSET is less than or equal to
for the stress period; if

is zero, set TOFFSET to zero. If the observation falls within a time step, the simulated equivalent is calculated by linearly interpolating between values for the beginning and end of the time step. If the first stress period is transient and the observation falls within the first time step, the simulated equivalent from the end of the time step is used because no flow from the beginning of the time step is available for interpolation.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: HOBS—is the observed drain-return-boundary flow [L

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:8pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-transform:none; vertical-align:super; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: /T]. For the DRT1 Package, only negative values of HOBS are expected. Negative values indicate flow out of the groundwater system.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: STATISTIC—is the value from which the weight for the observation is calculated as determined using STAT-FLAG.STATISTIC is ignored if
is greater than zero, in which case
of item 7 is used to define the weighting.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: STAT-FLAG—is a flag identifying what STATISTIC is and how the weight is calculated.

li.text: STAT-FLAG = 0, STATISTIC is a scaled variance [(L

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:8pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-transform:none; vertical-align:super; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:8pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-transform:none; vertical-align:super; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: STAT-FLAG = 1, STATISTIC is a scaled standard deviation [L

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:8pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-transform:none; vertical-align:super; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:8pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-transform:none; vertical-align:super; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: STAT-FLAG = 2, STATISTIC is a scaled coefficient of variation [dimensionless], weight = 1/[(STATISTIC × HOBS)

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:8pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-transform:none; vertical-align:super; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: PLOT-SYMBOL—is an integer that will be written to output files intended for graphical analysis to allow control of the symbols used when plotting data.
Data Set 5
Layer Row Column Factor (free format)
Read item 5 for each cell in this group; the number of cells equals the absolute value of
from item 3.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: LAYER—is the layer index of a drain cell included in the cell group.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: ROW—is the row index of a drain cell included in the cell group.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: COLUMN—is the column index of a drain cell included in the cell group.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: FACTOR—is the portion of the simulated drain flow in the cell that is included in the total simulated drain flow for this cell group (f

para.text: n
of eq. 9).
Read items 6 and 7 if
Data Set 6
FMTIN IPRN (free format)

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Data Set 7
) (format:
WTQ(

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: WTQ—is an NQTDR by
array containing the variance-covariance matrix on drain observations [(L3/T)2]. For elements WTQ(I,J), if I
¹

J, WTQ(I,J) is the covariance between observations I and J; if I = J, WTQ(I,J) is the variance of observation I. Note that the variance-covariance matrix is symmetric, but the entire matrix (upper and lower parts) must be entered.
